result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Edward Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Edward Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Edward Smith was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham April 9, 2015 - Court vacates sentence without objection.


Court dismisses Counts 1, 3 and 4.
Defendant to sign up for Probation by Tuesday December 16, 2014.
Bond to continue until Defendant is signed up for Probation.
Court notes 7 days credit against ultimate sentence.
Defendant may request early discharge from Probation after 2 years of successful participation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber, DF:  Joshua Edward Smith appeared. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads no contest to Ct 2 (possess meth - party). DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Cts 1, 3 and 4. PSI is waived at this time. Sentencing recommendations. Crt orders: S/W 3 years probation with conditions: 
- 60 days St. Croix County jail -  STAYED. To be used at the discretion of probation agent. 
- DNA surcharge is waived based on inability to pay.  
- Court costs $268.00 to be paid through probation. 
- AODA and recommended follow through. Defendant may sign release re: treatment participation for probation to use as AODA.
- Randan and regular testing
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
Defendant may request to be discharged from probation after 2 years of successful participation.
Bond will be vacated after def is signed up for probation. Defendant to sign up for probation by Tuesday, December 16. 
7 days credit against any ultimate sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Edward Smith
Current: 309 5th St, Genesis House, Centuria, WI 54824 United States  (Effective: 11-26-2014)
Prior: Serenity House, 200 Polk County Plaza, Balsam Lake, WI 54810 United States
per Defendant in court. kc

*AMENDED**

- DE to reside at Genesis House, 309 5th St in Centuria, WI 54824.  Genesis House is to notify the St Croix County Sheriff's Department immediately if defendant absconds from their facility (copy of bond provided to Genesis rep).
  
- Every Wednesday and Saturday defendant to undergo an observed UA testing at Genesis House.  If UA tests positive Genesis House is to contact the St Croix County Sheriff's Department immediately. Defendant must pay any costs or fees associated with this testing at time of each test. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- DE to retain and maintain full time employment

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cynthia S (except as it relates to family matters, i.e. CHPs case).  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
